meanings.definition: A member of the British hereditary order of honor, ranking below a baron and above a knight.
meanings.sent1: The baronet received his title due to his family's long history of service.
meanings.sent2: The baronet's estate was vast and well-maintained.
meanings.sent3: The baronet's horse neighed loudly, demanding attention.
meanings.sent4: In the land of nobility, the baronet was a shining star.
meanings.sent5: The baronet's presence commanded respect wherever he went.

meanings.definition: A title of honor given to a man of the lowest hereditary British nobility.
meanings.sent1: The baronet's family had proudly held the title for generations.
meanings.sent2: The young baronet was known for his generosity towards the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The baronet's dog, Sir Woofs-a-lot, was a beloved member of the household.
meanings.sent4: The baronet's kindness was a beacon of light in the community.
meanings.sent5: The baronet's portrait hung prominently in the grand hall of the manor.
